ygData.subject: Re: Operation Black Tower
ygData.msgSnippet: Quickstride walks up to a higher hill, to see if he can spot any activity from long range, and notices that the jets are now flying in a totally different

Quickstride walks up to a higher hill, to see if he can spot any activity f=
rom long range, and notices that the jets are now flying in a totally diffe=
rent direction, incicating that their attentions have been put elsewhere.

=
"Rodimus, you're right, somethn' just caught those jet's attentions..  What=
ever Tucson had up his manifold, looks like it's working.  Still, I dunno i=
f I'm ready ta let my guard down just yet."

From the firing range, Night S=
hift could see that Tucson's ploy was working, as Straight Shot works in un=
isen with Kup.  With the arrows fired, Straight Shot gives Kup the data he =
needs to make a direct hit, via using her physical weaponry form, and her g=
uidence systems.  It was now up to Kup to do the rest.

"Nice firing Kup, i=
t's working!  I'll continue to download the trajectory coordinates to you, =
and hopefully we'll get those plane brains to focus on something else other=
 than the fortress."

Night Shift nodds.

"Looks good, they're buyn' it.  I=
 dunno if we should stay still though, they could get a fix on us and then =
we're curtains.  I vote we slowly change our locations after a few shots, s=
o that way we can confuse the living heck outa their processors."

From Tuc=
son's vantage point, although unable to see what was happening, he keeps hi=
s com links open to his colleagues.  And from what he could surmise, things=
 were going according to plan.  But yet he still had to think of the "What =
If's."  There was always a chance that even a well thought out strategy cou=
ld go awry.

"From what I hear,things appear to be going well.  But we can =
not discount the fact that events have a way of turning on us abruptly.  Co=
ntinue on your paths, but be cautious."

Rat Trap who was now with Windlord=
 was happy to see that the jets were being distracted away from the fortres=
s.

"We copy that Wheels, okay Windlord, I think we can make our move, the =
distraction's working.  I'll leave it up ta you ta find the best way in.  Y=
ou know this place better than I do."

Tucson now continues to move in slow=
ly.  He keeps to hidden areas on the land with low vegitation, and travels =
by river beds, to be sure that his tires do not kick up any dirt or rubble.=
  His trailer keeps him from moving too fast, as he tries to maneuver it th=
rough the terrain.  That however did not bother him in the least.  He had n=
ever been one for speed, even in his old SUV form.  Things seemed rather fa=
milliar to him now, the way the situation was playing out, reminded him of =
older times, when Optimus Prime would lead his Autobots against the Decepti=
cons and how careful he was with his strategic skills.   And now, it was Tu=
cson Prime's turn to roll in Optimus Prime's tire treads.  As Hydras was a =
cobination of Galvatron and Megatron, Tucson Prime now comes to terms that =
Optimus Prime was now living within himself and for all intensive purposes,=
 he is now the new Optimus Prime.  He now sends a message to all Autobots a=
nd Maximals.

" Before I met up with all of you, my direction was unclear. =
 I thought that I'd be fighting a losing battle by myself, and for a long t=
ime, it seemed that way.  But then, along my travels, I met all of you, and=
 you brought me home, to the Ark, where you showed me where Optimus Prime r=
ests.  At first, I wished intensely that Optimus Prime could be brought bac=
k to life, and I believed that for the longest time.  Then, as I got to kno=
w all of you, and realized the big picture of what was happening, and then,=
 recieving the power of the Matrix of Leadership, I have now come to realiz=
e that it's far better to look ahead at who is around you now, and what is =
to happen in the future than to dwell on that of the past.  All of that wou=
ld not have been possible if I had not met all of you.  And for that I than=
k each and every Autobot and Maximal for putting me on the right path.  And=
 now, it's time for me to repay my debt to you all."

He thinks for a momen=
t.

" As Optimus Prime stood firmly against Megatron and the Decepticon Fac=
tion, I will firmly stand my ground against the Predacons and Decepticons. =
 And by the end of this battle, we will show them that it's unwise to under=
estimate our factions as they have done so up until now."

He inches closse=
r into his position.

" Let this be known, that to all Predacons and Decept=
icons, it will be a day of reckoning."

e on my neck stand on end.. Sorta like a horsefly ya can't

gotten that feeling before." Rodimus said over the com line to

e, "But we can get this off without a hitch." He chuckled, "I

ny hordes of Predacons coming down on us. That probably means

t been watching."

der, inside he knew that

s as well. It was indeed

n.

> > " Thank you for the intel Rodimus. Now I will be ab=
le to keep my sensors
> open for any wave disturbances. Ususally my sonar s=
ystems only pick up on
> solid objects, but there is a chance that fluxuati=
ons in energy waves, can
> be detected via echolocation. My systems are up =
and running now.. But
> there's one flaw, that kind of detection system is =
short range. If there's
> any disturbances long range, I will not be able t=
o detect them. I will do
> the best I can to keep alert."
> >
> > He rolls =
on with caution, trying not to kick up any dirt, or disturb
> anything arou=
nd him. As tires roll over uneven ground his trailer rocks
> slightly as he=
 tries hard to avoid too much movement from it.
> 
> <NEW>
> 
> "I understa=
nd." Rodimus said over the comlink, clearly confident in Tuscon's
> abiliti=
es. "I am going radio silent. Cheetor said that the Preds could hear
> him.=
 The sweeps have excellent hearing, and who knows what Hydras has built
> o=
ut there."
>

> > <OLD>
> >
> > "Here is Windlord"said the male by comli=
nk in a private maximal chanel"I'm
> > ready and in position"
> >
> > Kup t=
ook straing shot and said "Time to have some fun" he startd to track
> > th=
e enemy signature and opened fire against them
> 
> 
> <NEW>
> 
> For Kup a=
nd Straight Shot, trying to track the sweeps out there was trying
> to trac=
k ripples of heat rising on a desert savanna. Target locks ranged
> from fl=
eeting to next to impossible as the sweeps themselves flew through
> the th=
e air.
> 
> Optical sighting however proved effective as Kup pulled the tri=
gger and with
> a light *kuthunk!* he sent an arrow into the air, and then =
another and
> another. Quickly the small volley of arrows flew into the air=
 rising in a
> large arc, moving farther and more swiftly then any conventi=
onal arrow could
> have traveled.
> 
> It was difficult to see clearly at t=
his distance (20K) but it was obvious
> that at least one of the sweeps was=
 hit as one of them began to fall from
> the skies, smoke trailing after it=
. However the other four reacted! Like
> bees hows hive had been disturbed,=
 they flew around, erratic at first as if
> trying to discern the angle of =
attack, and then they began to fly in Kup's
> direction.
> 
> Although they=
 were still some kilometers away they were quickly closing the
> distance, =
they began to open fire as they closed!
> 
> OOC: They sweeps are still sev=
eral miles away, so the shots are more or less
> at long range. Its up to y=
ou guys if you want to be hit or not.
